product_overview: BookHaven is a comprehensive online bookstore platform designed to facilitate seamless book browsing, searching, purchasing, and seller book management with a focus on user experience, security, and performance.
core_goals: Provide a user-friendly interface for browsing and searching a wide catalog of books.
Offer secure user authentication and protected user-specific functionalities.
Enable a smooth and intuitive shopping cart and checkout process.
Support sellers in managing their book listings efficiently.
Deliver responsive design and optimized performance across devices.
Integrate external book data via Google Books API for enriched content.
Ensure data integrity and session persistence with JWT and local storage.
key_features: User Registration and Login with JWT authentication and session persistence.
Protected routes restricting access to authenticated users for dashboard and book management.
Dynamic book catalog with searching, filtering by category, pagination, and detailed book views.
Shopping cart with add, remove, update quantity features, and order summary checkout.
User dashboard showing profile info, order history, and account statistics.
Seller capabilities to add, edit, and delete books with image upload and validation.
Newsletter subscription form powered by EmailJS integration.
Responsive navigation header with search, cart badge, and authentication status display.
Footer with site links, social media, and contact info.
Lazy loading components for better performance and code splitting.
Animated loading spinner for async operations and page transitions.
user_flow_summary: Guests visit Home page showcasing featured books and call-to-action elements.
Users register an account via the Register page with email verification and secure password setup.
Authenticated users log in and access protected features like Dashboard and Cart.
Users browse Books catalog, search by title/author/category, filter, and paginate results.
Users view detailed information on individual books and can add them to their cart.
Users manage their cart by updating quantities or removing books, then proceed to checkout.
Sellers access My Books to manage their listings, edit or delete books, or add new book entries.
Users subscribe to newsletters through the subscription form utilizing EmailJS service.
Navigation header allows users to navigate seamlessly and see their cart status and login state.
validation_criteria: All authentication workflows must securely handle JWT tokens and maintain session persistence.
Protected routes must only allow access by authenticated users, with redirection implemented otherwise.
Book catalog must support search, filter, pagination, and display correct results.
Shopping cart operations must update state reliably and reflect changes accurately in UI.
Book addition and editing forms require validation for inputs and image uploads.
Newsletter subscription must send emails successfully via EmailJS integration.
Responsive UI tested across different devices and screen sizes for consistency.
Loading spinner displayed during all async network requests and page transitions.
Error states handled gracefully without impacting user experience.
Google Books API integration returns and displays accurate external book data when invoked.
